content:
Just a reminder that the FHIR North connectathon will be running in Hamilton, Ontario, Canada on Wed. April 27th. We still have some seats left if you're interested. We're running 3 of the tracks from the Montreal connectathon: Patient (entry level stream), Structured Data Capture (questionnaire stuff) and SMART on FHIR - CA (using SMART with Canadian profiles). If you want to do something else, there's an experimental track too. In addition to hacking, there will also be tutorials and networking opportunities. You can find more information here: http://www.fhirnorth.ca.

(And yes, we're happy to welcome our southern neighbors from the U.S. Or from anywhere for that matter :>)
take follow ups to the social stream please

The FHIR North connectathon is being held in conjunction with Apps4Health at Mohawk College in Hamilton, ON on Wed. Apr. 26th. Registration is only $125. Further information can be found at http://fhirnorth.ca.
To everyone, FHIRNorth along with Apps4Health was a great event - thanks to Mohawk College for sponsoring and supporting the event - FHIR North 240+ participants.

We’re less than a month away from the AppsForHealth and FHIR North 2018 Conference (April 25 & 26), one of Canada’s most exciting events dedicated to digital health. We’re thrilled to have amazing speakers and keynotes such as IBM and Redhat!

If you haven’t registered already, here is the link: http://appsandfhir.mohawkcollege.ca/ (if you have, then thanks!). If you’re also interested in speaking, make sure you fill out the Call for Speakers form on the website.

.. added to the FHIR Foundation calendar
FHIRNorth 2020 is going virtual! We're inviting the Canadian & Global #FHIR & #HL7 community to share their thoughts on topics, timing & more. Please complete this 3 min survey https://bit.ly/30tM3Bo
What sort of fee are you looking at?

FHIR North is confirmed for Oct. 14 and 15th. The speakers list is pretty much final and it looks like it will be an interesting couple of days. Early bird deadline is this Friday, so check it out soon. (And the good news is that when you visit us virtually, we won't turn you away even if you're not a Canadian :smile: ) Details are here: http://fhirnorth.ca/
@Lloyd McKenzie Curious to know canadian healthcare also focuses on FHIR?

FHIR North 2021 will be virtual again and held on Oct. 13 and 14. We're currently seeking speakers and proposed topics. Please submit your proposals here, ideally by June 30. Further discussion on #canada
